trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Uaauashe has a spray bottle with your name on it.
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_TODO_00<tab>Spray the extra-strength debugifier at the designated locations.
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_000<tab>Hey, I know you! You toured the farms with Her Majesty, right? How about something a little more hands-on?
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_001<tab>I've been assigned the role of cleaner, and one of my duties is the periodic application of insecticide.

TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_002<tab>Here─I've marked a few areas in need of treatment on your map. Take this extra-strength debugifier and give them a good, liberal coating. Let me know when you're done, okay?
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_003<tab>Each of those areas needs thorough spraying to keep the creepy-crawlies out. Let me know when you're done!
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_005<tab>Welcome back! Thank you for handling that, by the way. It will be some time before we need worry about any oglop sightings!
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_006<tab>As cleaners, we're responsible for sanitation, waste disposal, recycling─even land maintenance─all in the name of keeping our homes free of bacteria.

TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_007<tab>And unlike the entirely artificial Everkeep, we get a <var 1A 02 /var>lot<var 1A 01 /var> of bugs here in the outskirts. Trust me, they'll move right in if we let them.

TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_008<tab>Oglops in particular are the worst offenders. They spread disease through the germs they carry, so their extermination is nonnegotiable. Problem is, they're genetically predisposed to withstand even the harshest of environments, which makes them tough to kill.
TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_009<tab>Personally, I find them kind of cute, but as cleaners, we have a job to do.

TEXT_KINGZF001_05149_UAAUASHE_000_010<tab>We'll never be able to eradicate them completely on account of their propensity to breed, but thanks to your hard work, we've a few more moons before we need worry about them again. Here─for a job well done.
